eeguana 0.1.1.9000

Apply a zero-phase low-pass, high-pass, band-pass, or band-stop FIR filter.

Source: R/filters.R
filt.Rd

Apply a zero-phase low-pass, high-pass, band-pass, or band-stop filter of the FIR (finite impulse response) class to every segment of an eeg_lst. These filters are adapted from the default filters in MNE package (v 0.0.17.1) of python. For background information about the FIR vs IIR filters, see here.

eeg_filt_low_pass(.data, ..., freq = NULL, config = list(),
  na.rm = FALSE)

eeg_filt_high_pass(.data, ..., freq = NULL, config = list(),
  na.rm = FALSE)

eeg_filt_band_pass(.data, ..., freq = NULL, config = list(),
  na.rm = FALSE)

eeg_filt_band_stop(.data, ..., freq = NULL, config = list(),
  na.rm = FALSE)

Arguments

.data

A channel or an eeg_lst.
...

Channels to apply the filters to. All the channels by default.
freq

A single cut frequency for eeg_filt_low_pass and eeg_filt_high_pass, two edges for eeg_filt_band_pass and eeg_filt_band_stop.
config

Other parameters passed in a list to the ICA method. (Not implemented)
na.rm

=TRUE will set to NA the entire segment that contains an NA, otherwise the filter will stop with an error.

Value

A channel or an eeg_lst.

Details

  • eeg_filt_low_pass() Low-pass or high-cut filter.

  • eeg_filt_high_pass() High-pass or low-cut filter.

  • eeg_filt_band_pass() Band-pass filter.

  • eeg_filt_band_stop() Band-stop filter.

See also

Other preprocessing functions: eeg_baseline, eeg_downsample, eeg_ica_keep, eeg_ica, eeg_rereference, eeg_segment

Examples

library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
data("data_faces_ERPs")
data_ERPs_filtered <- data_faces_ERPs %>%
  eeg_filt_low_pass(freq = 1)
#> Setting up low-pass filter at 1 Hz
# Compare the ERPs
data_faces_ERPs %>%
  select(O1, O2, P7, P8) %>%
  plot() +
  facet_wrap(~.key)
#> Adding missing grouping variables: .sample
data_ERPs_filtered %>%
  select(O1, O2, P7, P8) %>%
  plot() +
  facet_wrap(~.key)
#> Adding missing grouping variables: .sample
